formattedAddress: 64 W 48th St, New York, NY 10036, USA
adrFormatAddress: 64 W 48th St, New York, NY 10036, USA

editorialSummary.text: Vintage-style restaurant and bar offering comfort food, cocktails, and an extensive whisky list.

originalText.text: The food is absolutely amazing. Everything we tried was beyond delicious! Especially the Elgin meatballs. The mushroom pizza was very good too, but it’s more like a flatbread. Cocktails are great. The place was super loud though when we were there so it’s virtually impossible to have a conversation and the service was rushed—maybe because the place was packed. Overall a great experience.

text.text: The food is absolutely amazing. Everything we tried was beyond delicious! Especially the Elgin meatballs. The mushroom pizza was very good too, but it’s more like a flatbread. Cocktails are great. The place was super loud though when we were there so it’s virtually impossible to have a conversation and the service was rushed—maybe because the place was packed. Overall a great experience.

originalText.text: We wandered in here looking for drinks and a midday snack. I loved the vibe- beautifully relaxed. We got the rice balls and pigs in a blanket. The food was very good. The rice balls came with a Parmesan cheese sauce. They were creamy on the inside and wonderfully crispy crunchy on the outside. The pigs in a blanket were well done as well. A hearty chunk of hot dog wrapped with a flaky puffed pastry. They came with sauerkraut and mustard- both of which were fabulous pairings.  The service however was not great. Our server was friendly and helpful. But one of my pet peeves these days is servers not writing things down. Sure- cool party trick if you get everything right. But only about 10% of the time does that happen. We didn't get the fries we ordered and had to ask for water several times. They also disappeared for long periods of time, despite not being super busy.  Despite this, we would give it another try as the food was worth it and I know servers are tired after a busy holiday season.

originalText.text: Nice little restaurant to stop in to.  Low lighting and a chill atmosphere.  We really only stopped for a snack so we ate fairly light.  We shared the pepperoni pizza and a bowl of the French onion soup which was plenty.  One odd thing was that the bathroom is extremely cramped and small.  And I mean small!  No room to wash your hands as you are blocking the door.  Overall a good experience though.

originalText.text: my colleague & i went to the elgin for a holiday dinner. it was my first time going and we were looking for a place that screamed Christmas! beautiful decorations, simple & chic decor! our waitress was great and the staff did alert us about a private party coming to our area in a timely & accommodating manner! i had a few espresso martinis & the tuna poke nachos, which were amazing & a nice take on nachos!

originalText.text: Great Ambiance, Great Taste…The restaurant's modern yet welcoming atmosphere set the stage for an amazing dining experience. The food was outstanding. The attention to detail in both taste and presentation makes this place a good choice in Ny
